content: without so many stitch markers you could also skip the first 2 rounds cast on 8 and begin on round 3 this will create a hole that will need to be closed later handles once you have created a bucket you will be casting off some stitches and putting others on hold if you are working on a circular needle the live stitches can be squished together or you simply put the live stitches on waste yarn row 1 *cast off 6 and knit 20* x 4 each section of 20 will be deceased at the edges become our handles and than grafted together we are now working flat until we finish for the first handle you have worked 20 stitches across and reached the bor remove marker and turn your work the other 3 handles will begin on the ws these instructions will be repeated for each handle looking at ws attach new yarn and work across for this first row knit or purl is fine neither is wrong purling will keep the pattern though turn work to rs row 1 k1 k2tbl work until 3 stitches remain k2tog k1 turn work row 2 purl across turn work continue row 1 and 2 until you have 10 stitches note the second decrease can be either k2tog or k2tbl k2tog for ease or k2tbl to mirror the k2tog on the other side your choice work in stockinette stitch by knitting on the rs and purling on the ws for 4-5 inches measured from last decrease end after completing a rs row when your finished put those 10 stitches on waste yarn and let them hang out note i chose stockinette stitch because it stretches less than garter it s easy to change the design or length just keep in mind how fiber and construction effects stretch after you ve completed all 4 handle straps we will now graft 2 together twice using 3 needle bind off put live stitches onto your needles and hold together with rs facing themselves you will be working k2tog but with 1 stitch from each needle this will bind off and connect them at the same time note by having the rs facing each other it will create the seam on the inside if you d prefer the seam be on the outside simple work the 3 needle bind off with ws facing if you don t want any seam i suggest checking out kitchener stitch weave in your ends and enjoy ~ suggested videos https //www
